description: The root cause identified in this post relates to a failure in appropriate patch management practices during the upgrade processes in server environments, specifically noted for the inability to effectively transition through intermediate upgrade steps. When upgrading to newer server versions, such as Windows Server 2022, it is essential to follow the N -2 rule, which ensures that updates from the last two versions are addressed before moving to the current version. This mismanagement can lead to inconsistencies in system configurations and eventual instability. The lack of adherence to this general rule can result in critical operational disruptions, particularly in enterprise-scale deployments where multiple systems interact with each other, leading to a cascading effect of failures. Furthermore, it is crucial to monitor and implement pending updates aligned with Microsoft’s KB articles to maintain system integrity throughout the upgrade process.
